priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Susceptibility Test Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C128687

self.title: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Susceptibility Test Name Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test names that define microorganism responses to antimicrobial agents.
name: Microbiology Susceptibility Test Name
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Susceptibility Test Name Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of the diameter of the circular region of bacteria growth inhibition that surrounds an antibiotic source on the surface of a cultured plate.
terms.submissionValue: Diameter of the Zone of Inhibition
synonyms: Diameter of the Zone of Inhibition

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the pre-specified mutations of interest are present in the subject.

An indication of reduced or increased susceptibility of a microbial organism, or activity of a biological/biochemical reaction in response to the inhibitory concentration (IC50 and/or IC95) of a specific drug.
A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of population growth or replication of a microbial organism. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline
terms.submissionValue: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline
synonyms: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline

terms.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the EC50 Subject Result divided by the EC50 Reference Control Result. (NCI)
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference
terms.submissionValue: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Ref
synonyms: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Ref
Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference

terms.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism. (NCI)

A measurement of titer of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism. (NCI)

A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the current IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Subject Result from the baseline visit.
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline
terms.submissionValue: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline
synonyms: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline

terms.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Reference Control Result.
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference
terms.submissionValue: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Ref
synonyms: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Ref
Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference

terms.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

A measurement of biological/biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the current IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Subject Result from the baseline visit.
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline
terms.submissionValue: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline
synonyms: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline

terms.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Reference Control Result.
terms.preferredTerm: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref
terms.submissionValue: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref
synonyms: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref

terms.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

A measurement of biological/biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.
A phenotypic or genotypic assessment of the response of the microbial organism to an antimicrobial agent.
A measurement that specifies the minimum concentration of the agent at which organism growth was inhibited.
An indication as to whether one or more scored mutations of interest that may confer susceptibility in the microorganism is present.
